notesStmt.note: Lacunae after folios: 7, 8, 16, 22, 53, 71, 91, 99, 107, 115, 119, 133, 143. Many folios stained or water-damaged.

Folio 150v contains a geneology of the previous owner and a rhyme. Avraham ben Shelomoh ben Shemu᾿el ben Eliyahu ben Aharon ben Yitsḥaḳ ben Eliyahu Firuz: inscribed in a note, folio 1r . An entry recording the name and genealogy of the same owner is also found on folio 150v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Japheth ben Ali ha-Levi on the book of Job, chapters 23-42.

collation.p: 18 quires (nos. 1-2, 4-19), originally of 10 leaves each (except the 18th which has 11 leaves). Apart from the quires 6-8, 11-12, 17, all the quires are imperfect. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic words on the upper margin of the first page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square and semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Yefet. Comm. on Job. Vol. II. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2511.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [151v].
